title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?
author: Archive

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Lance
This is the nicest T205 Cobb I have had in my hands. The scans do not justly represent the blazing colors on the front. 4 crisp corners and brilliant resolution! There is a small spot of paper loss or paper stuck to the lower right corner on the back. The entire border is there, but it looks faint. Guaranteed to be authentic. The card is slightly OVER-sized. Judge for yourself, ask me any questions you have, and make me an offer. 

[IMG]http://i175.photobucket.com/albums/w153/bamacollection/Cobbraw1002.jpg[/IMG] [IMG]http://i175.photobucket.com/albums/w153/bamacollection/Cobbraw1003.jpg[/IMG]

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?
posts.post_content:
Posted By: JimB
I would definitely send that one to PSA not SGC.  PSA is much kinder on back damage.  Could get a 4 or 5.
JimB

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Matt
Jim - from my observation while, PSA is kinder to back PL, they are more harsh on glue residue, so I'm not sure PSA would give a higher grade on this one.

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Lance
Jim,
I think this card is the exception to the rule. I don't care if receives a 1, as long as I can state it hasn't been trimmed. When that happens, the front will do the rest.

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Lance
Thanks for all the advice, guys. I just received the card back and after seeing it in the holder, I disagree with the grade even more. I spoke with SGC and they said it was trimmed. It was actually a relief because as nice as this is, I was worried about color. I believe PSA will get a shot at this one. Should I remove the card or submit it holdered? Here it is under 1200 dpi.

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Bryan Long
I do not deal with t205 cards much, but it doesn't look trimmed to me.  Experts on the set may feel otherwise.  As for cracking it out, I think it depends on if you want it to remain in the holder or not.  I would say crack it out and send it in.  I feel you would get a more unbiased look at it that way.

.

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?

Posted By: Sean BH

But it looks good to me.

Sean

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Jeff Lichtman
Yeah, of course crack it out -- what do you have to lose?  An "A" grade?  And fwiw, it doesn't look trimmed from that pic but who knows.

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Mac Wubben
Next to uneven borders from bad trimming, uneven corner (elongated triangles) wear is a classic give-away of trimming (though not 100% reliable).  The fact that it is still oversized wouldn't reassure me at all...only increases my doubt.  Still, it's a fantastic card...and I would love to have it.  

Mac

posts.post_title: FS:T205 Ty Cobb, Front is NM/MT, Back From PSA! Good 2 ! Offers?
posts.post_content:
Posted By: Matt
Just my 2 cents, but I don't think the technical grade has much bearing on the value of this card - in an open auction I don't think the price realized would differ whether it was an "A", a 2 or a 2.5.  The value here has everything to do with the attractive front.
